result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Paul Graves

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Defendant Christopher Paul Graves in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Christopher Paul Graves.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery but needs time to discuss a resolution. Attorney Ocwieja requests a District Attorney pre trial conference. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:27 AM Defendant Christopher Paul Graves in court.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Christopher Paul Graves.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Information previously filed. Defendant waives reading of information. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf. The state has provided discovery to defense. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:01 PM Defendant Christopher Paul Graves in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by phone for Christopher Paul Graves. The Court vacates the warrant. Court orders previously posted cash bond to be returned to poster. Previous bond to be reinstated with same monetary conditions. Matter to be set over for arraignment with Judge Jorgenson. Clerk to contact Attorney Ocwieja and Lafayette county to schedule. Bond set.

Violation - Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater: Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater 2cts. Issuing
Agency - Monroe PD.
No violent or abusive contact with: J.A.G. May not possess or consume any intoxicants. Mav not enter
establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants
with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores. Mav enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not
go into the area where intoxicants are sold.
Payor: Julie Graves w/ Monroe P.D.
Bench Warrant  GF-142_1 - Graves, Christopher Paul.docx

10:42 AM Defendant Christopher Paul Graves not in court.  Attorney Matt Lantta appears on behalf of Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video for Christopher Paul Graves. Atty Ocweija states the DE changed his number and he does not have an updated phone. ADA Lantta requests a bench Warrant for $500.00 cash state of WI only. The Court issues warrant $500 cash state wide.
Arraignment on July 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Christopher Paul Graves in court, in custody with  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin.  State complied with Victim Witness Notification. Victim is present in person.  Monroe Police Officer Jacob Allen, Sworn on oath & testifies under direct by ADA Kohl.  Witness identifies the defendant.  Cross by Atty Ocwieja.  Witness excused.  Exhibit 1 Marked, identified, offered, received by the Court.  Testimony of victim witness is addressed by the parties.  J.G. Sworn on oath & testifies under direct by Atty Ocwieja.  Cross by ADA Kohl.  Re-direct by Atty Ocwieja.  ADA Kohl summary statement.  Atty Ocwieja waives statement and argues against bindover.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial.  INFO provided to parties.  Set for arraignment.
